pros: This agency excels in so many areas - being well-organized, providing clear structure and guidance, offering free trainings and great benefits, and having an excellent work culture. There are opportunities for those beginning their career, or looking for opportunities for advancement.
cons: As a FT therapist, the caseload is relatively large, so it requires good time management and the ability to set boundaries.

pros: -As a therapist, you get exposure to different types of populations -The pay is decent
cons: -Clients are mandated so they consistently No Show or don't show up on time -Supervisors are not as supportive & some clients are abusive or threatening -The culture of the clinic is money-driven & not caring of the clients -As a therapist, I felt unsafe around certain clients & the administration did nothing to address this -There is no work/life balance

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: they really try to include the remote staff
cons: after your guaranteed period you get paid per client, which can either lower or raise your income.

job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor in Bronx, NY
pros: - Supportive environment - Many compensations - Room to grow and make more money at your own pace
cons: - Limited population - No no show/late cancellation fee

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Opportunity to gain valuable experience and learn what does and DOESNT work for you as a clinician.
cons: An crowded caseload of clients, making it harder to complete treatment plans, progress notes and attend to all of their needs as well as the agency deadlines. You will be spread THIN!

review_title: Great company but a lot of work
pros: -great benefits -pays well -supportive staff -flexible-ish schedule
cons: -Caseload is high -have to work a weekend day -late nights

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Good support from supervisor and training specialists. On-going trainings. Good benefits.
cons: Fee for service may lead to burnout

job_title: Bilingual Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Provides training, bonus, small events within the clinic and support
cons: Too many clients in your caseload and not enough time to complete it earlier

pros: Some fun events and employee gifts.
cons: This place is a toxic workplace, you feel like a cog in the machine and no one cares about you. Staff appreciation/gifts just feels like throwing us a bone when everything else around you is a disaster.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: They cover your benefits fully for yourself and the insurance is pretty okay. There is room for growth and you get access to CEUS.
cons: Way too much paperwork, lower rates than usual and it is a FFS model, which is fine but in order to make good money you have to work a lot and risk burn out in the process.

pros: Exposer to therapy setting , nice clients & co-workers.
cons: I am not sure where to start. The management & HR are the most unprofessional and rude people I've ever worked with. They are very intrusive in your personals life, ask inappropriate questions, does not respect the autonomy of staff. This place has high turnover rate and they recycle new graduates without experience and license every year. No one last here for more than one year. If you are a new graduate without experience & license and you don't have any other pending job offer then consider it, but I don't recommend this place unless this is your only option. If you are professional with experience and license, please do not come with with long term plans. There are much better placed where you will be treated with respect with your masters degree than here. The way they treat their clerical staff is also unacceptable,

pros: learn a lot about mental health
cons: a lot of phone calls and people traffic

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Brooklyn, NY
pros:
Positive work environment 
The doctors and PNPs are great to work with
cons:
It is difficult to get your schedule changed
Not paid enough for all that you need to do

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Brooklyn, NY
pros:
It's a team, you'll never be alone in a stressful situation. Free food on certain days.
Great commuter benefits.
cons: underpaid clerical staff, they do so much! High turn over among clerical, it's exhausting for long term employees to have to retrain and retrain new people (They should assign someone and compensate that person for the extra training).

job_title: Employee Engagement Specialist in New York, NY
pros: love the staff and the flexible hours
cons: no windows in the building

review_title: Do not do it for more than 6 months
job_title: Bilingual Front Desk Receptionist (Spanish) in Bronx, NY
pros: Benefits, the connections you make. The experience.
cons: Low pay for the amount of work given, no consideration from management about the stress/work they assign. High turnover rate. Little to no appreciation for the work you do.

pros: Create own schedule,work from home, private office, and decent benefits. You will get alot of hands on experience helping a variety of populations
cons: Sessions normally run between 30-45 minutes. Some clients may request twice a week sessions and request couples therapy. Agency does not provide Esa letters for support animals

review_title: A ORGANIZATION TO BUILD YOUR CAREER ON!!!
job_title: Community OUtreach Specialist in Bronx, NY
pros: Amazing benefits. They provide medical coverage for all staff at no cost to you and they also help pay down your student loans. I have been working for NYPCC for almost a year now throughout this pandemic. Its truly a great company to work for. Everyone is friendly and the administrators starting from the C.E.O down to the front desk are amazing! They care about their staff and they have staff appreciation day/ giveaways/prizes/ luncheons and other activities to keep the staff engaged and excited to work here. The clinic is always clean and everyone is very professional here. NYPCC is a company you can build your career on.
cons: As of now, there is not any!

pros: Endless clients, can make good money if motivated
cons: Little to no training when hired. Lots of attitude, insults and discrimination from HR personnel.

review_title: Lots of work but pays well
job_title: Mental Health Counselor/Psychotherapist in Bronx, NY
pros: High pay, clients provided for you
cons: High caseload and rapid sessions

pros: full time hours, fun environment, always busy
cons: They use your pto time for holiday pay

pros: It truly has been a rewarding experience to be part of NYPCC family. It is a privilege to be able to serve and help my community. There are plenty of opportunities to advance within the company, job security is great. Great medical, dental and vision benefits, annual bonus, team spirit events and wellness groups. The facilities are well manteined.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: If you write them a good review they’ll give you an “incentive”.
cons: Chief Human Resources Officer, lacks communication skills: does not know how to talk to people. HR does not care about The employees or the clients being served her main goal is money. The company overwork you and does not compensate adequately for your time. Supervisors are very unprofessional, they are dishonest and do not establish clear communication with their employees. If you want days off this is not the job for you, they will call you 24/7. You are held to unreasonable work rules. Frankly, I should have noticed the red flags during orientation when they tell you to write a good review for the company.

pros: Health, life insurance, bonus & tuition reimbursement. 401K
cons: High overload work tasks, small 30 min breaks, high stress level

review_title: Low pay and a lot of work
pros: Great support and the team is great
cons: The pay is just to low for the amount of commitment they want from you.

pros: NYPCC recognizes hard work and promotes education and professional growth. I started in 2008 which speaks to how much I am appreciated and how much I love working here!
cons: I have none at the moment.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Company has room for growth. Company staff are friendly and can be supportive.
cons: Paperwork is of abundance. Supervision can be offered in more frequency. Licensed clinicians don’t get paid more for being licensed.

pros:
NYPCC is an environment conducive to learning and professional growth. When I began working in NYPCC in August of 2013 as a therapist and intake worker I had the opportunity to work with a diverse caseload of clients in different age groups, backgrounds and diagnoses. Throughout my career at NYPCC I have been fortunate enough to receive promotions to Task Manager, Clinical Supervisor and ultimately Assistant Administrator. As a Task Manager I had the opportunity to ensure the quality assurance of patient records. As an Assistant Administrator and supervisor at NYPCC I've had the opportunity to oversee therapists, challenge and encourage their own professional growth.

I believe NYPCC holds its employee to a high standard. There is continuous training and agency wide mandates throughout the years to improve the quality of care and work produced at all levels of the agency. As an employee and member of the administrative team I appreciate the standard of care provided to the community we serve.
cons: NYPCC is a fast paced. Therefore, in order to thrive in this environment the individual must be self-motivated, adaptable, engaged, responsible and have great time management skills.

pros: You are allowed to schedule your own hours
cons: Cut throat management, legalized fraud, overbooking, you are just a number, pay is uncompetitive

pros: Having your own office space, working with great co-workers, flexibility
cons: Frequent burnout due to having to manage with 55 clients in a week, lack of consistency in receiving quality supervision, providing standard 30-minute sessions instead of quality 45-minute sessions (you can do 45, but they would be few and far in-between), cases closing faster than you getting new cases

review_title: Best Company I've Ever Worked For!
job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Superiors and co-workers are kind and respectful towards each other and patients. Patients are our priority and we are thoroughly trained to serve them with ethics and empathy. I have learned a lot from this company and would recommend to anyone who wants a place that will help to achieve the goal of healing the mind in a wholesome environment.
cons: So far, I've worked with the company for three years and haven't had any issues. I try not to bring my personal problems to work and it has helped me to effectively develop a good work environment for myself. So, no cons for now.

pros: Being able to work w/ a diverse population in order to develop and strengthen clinical skills, growth opportunity as the agency expands, availability of management including upper management/administration, clean work environment as janitorial staff is readily available,  being able to personalize office by being able to decorate, in house training,  vacation time that increases based on time working for the company, student loan pay down program,  100 % covered health/ vision benefits or very affordable upgraded benefits, HSA,   6 paid holidays,  and agency wide events/outings.
cons: As with any other agency the paperwork and keeping up with deadlines in order to satisfy OMH guidelines.

pros: I have worked for the agency for a total of seven years in different roles. I have worked with other agencies and this is the first time that I can say that I am working in a supportive environment.  NYPCC promotes learning and growth. The staff is supportive and provides opportunities to learn and grow professionally as well as clinically.  NYPCC helps to enhance your clinical as well as your supervisory skills. The agency also offers perks such as agency sponsored events, assistance with loans, and great gifts! Management is always looking for ways to bring about positive changes
cons: No cons come to my mind

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Springfield Gardens, NY
pros: The client care was excellent, staff really prioritizes the health of the clients. Regular team meetings were held weekly and  direct supervisor was accessible.  Upper management was able to recognize quality employees and treat them well.
cons: Pay is low (like all mental health fields), employee benefits were limited. Difficult to take time off due to the high work loads and short staff.  Employee happiness and culture did not seem to be a priority in the company's growth plan.

pros: Supportive co-workers, help pay off loans, stable hours
cons: not paid your worth, you are overworked, not flexible with school schedule, unprofessional management, unreasonable work rules, no consideration for outside life, management is not honest, no clear communication between management and employees.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Working for the agency for 4 years have been a positive experience. I've learnt to develop as a clinician and have received support that encourages growth. The agency administration have demonstrated interest to improve how the therapists and other staff manage the workload. The well-being of the clients are a priority.
cons: Like in any other agency, the documentation can take significant amount of time.

pros: Great sense of community within the work place. Some employees are bad apples but that’s to be expected in a large company. Orientation was amazing, complete with a goodie-bag and free breakfast/lunch. Great place to learn and grow. The Klein’s are a very friendly family to work for!!
cons: To my understanding, vacation/sick/personal time off is accumulated through how many hours you’ve worked. Most companies automatically give your 5 days vacation. That is not the case here.

review_title: NYPCC-a great place to develop and grow clinically
pros: rewarding experience that allows one to gain a great deal of experience in the field, positive, collaborative work environment, supervisors that go the extra mile to help you acclimate to the workload, good benefits, competitive pay, room for growth if you work hard
cons: fast paced environment, a lot of paperwork

job_title: Senior Case Manager in Brooklyn, NY
pros: I've worked with the company for over 8 years, I've seen the company grow a lot. There's  are a lot of advantages working in this company, there's a lot of space to grow and learn many things.
cons: The cons would have to be the lack of communications at times whenever there is a change, for example in management

job_title: Quality Management Coordinator in Bronx, NY
pros: I have worked at the agency for over 5 years and continue to be thankful for that I have learned and continue to learn. My clinical and administrative skills have developed with the support of great supervisors and co-workers. The schedule is flexible and make you feel like you are part of a family.
cons: The area is somewhat intimidating if you work a late shift.

review_title: Great Place to Start Your Career
pros: Great collaborative environment and an excellent place to start your career. The administrators/supervisors are always available for guidance and support. Excellent training from day 1 including NYPCC Academy. Full health benefits, employee discounts, team events as well as other great perks.
cons: Nothing specific I can think of

pros: Great EHR system that is easy to navigate and able to gain experience working at a fast pace environment. There are some clinical professionals willing to help you when needed.
cons: Gossip or rumors about staff are valued more than the hard work of any employee at any level. If upper management or administrator dislike you for any personal reason, they will fire you and not care about the reflected hard work.  Poor human resource management that has led to an even bigger employee turnover.

pros: You are able to make as much money you are willing to work for.
cons: It's difficult to balance the large caseload if you have any other responsibilities outside of work. This is just the nature of this type of work, not a short coming of the company.

pros: opportunities to make overtime, I have been able to grow within the company, great health benefits, a lot of fun activities for the employees (indoor and outdoor)
cons: the clinic needs more parking space.

review_title: This is a great place to grow professionally!
job_title: Community OUtreach Specialist in Bronx, NY
pros: I love that NYPCC truly cares and engages with the community to meet everyone's needs. NYPCC acknowledges their employee's good work and they have great career opportunities.
cons: There are really no cons to working here. This is a great place for career growth and opportunity.

pros: From my observations, they will hire anybody who has the right academic background and prescribe psychtropics freely. Plus, they only accept Medicaid (or at least this was true in 2016) which judging by what I saw is because they assume that these clients will not have the know how regarding questioning their treatment or the services rendered.
cons: All. I wouldn't recommend to a client or worker. Supervisors don't supervise as they are busy with their own caseloads.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: the environment and the staff are welcoming and caring. NYPCC offers good benefits and hold many events and giveaways which boost morale and productivity.  Room for growth and flexibility.
cons: pay could be better and paperwork can be overwhelming if have poor management skills.

job_title: Case Manager Supervisor/Therapist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Amazing work environment, CEO takes time to listen to input made my employees, opportunity for growth, supportive administrative team, competitive pay, clean and safe work space.  Free coffee
cons: Lack of parking spaces at the Bushwick location

pros: Pay was excellent,  co-workers are nice, flexible hours, supervision and team outings

cons: Pay is low (like all mental health fields), employee benefits were limited. Difficult to take time off due to the high work loads and short staff.  Employee happiness and culture did not seem to be a priority in the company's growth plan.

pros: Supportive co-workers, help pay off loans, stable hours
cons: not paid your worth, you are overworked, not flexible with school schedule, unprofessional management, unreasonable work rules, no consideration for outside life, management is not honest, no clear communication between management and employees.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: Working for the agency for 4 years have been a positive experience. I've learnt to develop as a clinician and have received support that encourages growth. The agency administration have demonstrated interest to improve how the therapists and other staff manage the workload. The well-being of the clients are a priority.
cons: Like in any other agency, the documentation can take significant amount of time.

pros: Great sense of community within the work place. Some employees are bad apples but that’s to be expected in a large company. Orientation was amazing, complete with a goodie-bag and free breakfast/lunch. Great place to learn and grow. The Klein’s are a very friendly family to work for!!
cons: To my understanding, vacation/sick/personal time off is accumulated through how many hours you’ve worked. Most companies automatically give your 5 days vacation. That is not the case here.

review_title: NYPCC-a great place to develop and grow clinically
pros: rewarding experience that allows one to gain a great deal of experience in the field, positive, collaborative work environment, supervisors that go the extra mile to help you acclimate to the workload, good benefits, competitive pay, room for growth if you work hard
cons: fast paced environment, a lot of paperwork

job_title: Senior Case Manager in Brooklyn, NY
pros: I've worked with the company for over 8 years, I've seen the company grow a lot. There's  are a lot of advantages working in this company, there's a lot of space to grow and learn many things.
cons: The cons would have to be the lack of communications at times whenever there is a change, for example in management

job_title: Quality Management Coordinator in Bronx, NY
pros: I have worked at the agency for over 5 years and continue to be thankful for that I have learned and continue to learn. My clinical and administrative skills have developed with the support of great supervisors and co-workers. The schedule is flexible and make you feel like you are part of a family.
cons: The area is somewhat intimidating if you work a late shift.

review_title: Great Place to Start Your Career
pros: Great collaborative environment and an excellent place to start your career. The administrators/supervisors are always available for guidance and support. Excellent training from day 1 including NYPCC Academy. Full health benefits, employee discounts, team events as well as other great perks.
cons: Nothing specific I can think of

pros: Great EHR system that is easy to navigate and able to gain experience working at a fast pace environment. There are some clinical professionals willing to help you when needed.
cons: Gossip or rumors about staff are valued more than the hard work of any employee at any level. If upper management or administrator dislike you for any personal reason, they will fire you and not care about the reflected hard work.  Poor human resource management that has led to an even bigger employee turnover.

pros: You are able to make as much money you are willing to work for.
cons: It's difficult to balance the large caseload if you have any other responsibilities outside of work. This is just the nature of this type of work, not a short coming of the company.

pros: opportunities to make overtime, I have been able to grow within the company, great health benefits, a lot of fun activities for the employees (indoor and outdoor)
cons: the clinic needs more parking space.

review_title: This is a great place to grow professionally!
job_title: Community OUtreach Specialist in Bronx, NY
pros: I love that NYPCC truly cares and engages with the community to meet everyone's needs. NYPCC acknowledges their employee's good work and they have great career opportunities.
cons: There are really no cons to working here. This is a great place for career growth and opportunity.

pros: From my observations, they will hire anybody who has the right academic background and prescribe psychtropics freely. Plus, they only accept Medicaid (or at least this was true in 2016) which judging by what I saw is because they assume that these clients will not have the know how regarding questioning their treatment or the services rendered.
cons: All. I wouldn't recommend to a client or worker. Supervisors don't supervise as they are busy with their own caseloads.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: the environment and the staff are welcoming and caring. NYPCC offers good benefits and hold many events and giveaways which boost morale and productivity.  Room for growth and flexibility.
cons: pay could be better and paperwork can be overwhelming if have poor management skills.

job_title: Case Manager Supervisor/Therapist in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Amazing work environment, CEO takes time to listen to input made my employees, opportunity for growth, supportive administrative team, competitive pay, clean and safe work space.  Free coffee
cons: Lack of parking spaces at the Bushwick location

review_title: Welcoming and responsive staff make coming onboard with NYPCC easy and exciting.
pros: Great benefits, friendly staff, and an informative and helpful onboarding process. Additionally, the workplace is diverse and the organization is very supportive of its employees.
cons: At present, I have no cons to speak of.

pros: Pay was excellent,  co-workers are nice, flexible hours, supervision and team outings
cons: Working one weekend day every week but I do get Sunday and Monday off

pros: Opportunity to work with diverse populations and grow as a therapist. Agency has great training and provides clinical supervision for licensure. Excellent benefits and great work environment!
cons: It can be a fast paced environment. Time Management skills are a must!

pros: People look out for you. Make sure you get out the office to stretch. It can get lonely in there. Make sure to reach out.
cons: No show clients gets annoying sometimes

review_title: 33 Years in the Industry, this is the best position of them
job_title: Social Worker in East Meadow, NY
pros: Flexible schedule, good benefits, gifts, great teamwork, administration is supportive
cons: I wish I had control over some areas I don't supervise sometimes.

pros: Free health insurance, supervision towards your license, paid time off, flexibility in your schedule, awesome colleagues, being able to help people in the community
cons: It's frustrating when clients no-show for their appointments

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Bronx, NY
pros: large client base, minimal paper work, and friendly staff
cons: only paid for services provided and no benefits

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Jamaica, NY
pros: Friendly management, Friendly staff, company gifts, pandemic friendly (remote work)
cons: No cons to list at the moment

job_title: Activity Therapist in Springfield Gardens, NY
pros: This company id good when it comes to movie up within the company. But there is a cap depending on your skill set.
cons: The company offers poor benefits. You have to work for your PTO. V action time and sick days are clump together. Poor compensation

pros: Easy job to do.
cons: Not as flexible with your schedule as they make it seem.

pros: Good salary, vacation  and overtime
cons: No teamwork, change of decision very often.

review_title: don do it for your own sanity
pros: generous company events , a solid HR team
cons: unfair pay, not to much room for advancement and professional development. Toxic administration
